intro: Gagea bohemica subsp. corsica, commonly known as Corsican spring beauty, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in woodland or scrub habitats. It is relatively short-lived, with a lifespan of about 3 to 5 years. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
